title: --select and --ignore do not seem to work
body:
In GitLab by @NorthIsUp on Nov 1, 2016, 20:57

Sometime after upgrading from flake8 2.x the `--select` and `--ignore` options stopped working as I would expect.


This is some command line testing I did to demonstrate the issue
```bash
$ python --version
Python 2.7.12

$ cat <<EOF > test.py
import os

def foo():
    pass

EOF

$ flake8 --version
3.1.0.dev0 (pyflakes: 1.3.0, pycodestyle: 2.0.0, mccabe: 0.5.2) CPython 2.7.12 on Darwin

$ flake8 test.py
test.py:1:1: F401 'os' imported but unused
test.py:3:1: E302 expected 2 blank lines, found 1
test.py:5:1: W391 blank line at end of file

$ flake8 --select E test.py # Expect F and W alerts
test.py:1:1: F401 'os' imported but unused
test.py:3:1: E302 expected 2 blank lines, found 1

$ flake8 --select D test.py  # D being an unused prefix right now
test.py:1:1: F401 'os' imported but unused

$ flake8 --ignore E test.py # Expect F and W alerts
test.py:1:1: F401 'os' imported but unused
test.py:3:1: E302 expected 2 blank lines, found 1
test.py:5:1: W391 blank line at end of file

$ flake8 --ignore E,F,W test.py # Expect no alerts
test.py:1:1: F401 'os' imported but unused
test.py:3:1: E302 expected 2 blank lines, found 1
test.py:5:1: W391 blank line at end of file
```


This is the same testing tied up in a reusable script.
```bash
echo '--> versions'
echo '----> pthon' $(python -c 'import sys; print("{}.{}.{}".format(*sys.version_info))')
echo '---->' $(pip --version)
echo '----> setuptools' $(python -c 'import setuptools; print(setuptools.__version__)')

cat <<EOF > test.py
import os

def foo():
    pass

EOF

function tester() {
    echo "--> $1"
    shift
    echo "----> flake8 $@"
    flake8 "$@"
}

echo $(flake8 --version)

tester 'no options set' test.py
tester 'expect only E alerts' --select E test.py # Expect F and W alerts
tester 'expect no alerts' --select D test.py  # D being an unused prefix right now
tester 'expect no E alerts' --ignore E test.py # Expect F and W alerts
tester 'expect no E,F,W alerts' --ignore E,F,W test.py # Expect no alerts
```

## version info

*Please provide the following version information*

- Version of Python which has Flake8 installed (e.g., `python -V`)

reproduced under 2.7.12 and 3.5.2

- How you installed Flake8 (e.g., `pip`, `apt`, `yum`, etc.)

reproduced under pip, and git + `pip install -e .`

- If you used pip, the version of pip installed (e.g., `pip --version`)

8.1.2

- Version of setuptools installed (e.g., `python -c 'import setuptools; print(setuptools.__version__)'`)

18.4

- Version of Flake8 installed (i.e., copy and paste all of the output from `flake8 --version`)

reproduced with 3.1.0-dev and 3.0.4
